seo.title_override: Detroit Mattress Disposal Guide 2026: Easy & Legal Options
seo.meta_desc_override: Detroit residents, easily dispose of your old mattress with convenient curbside pickup! Learn all the rules for proper disposal in 2026. No fines to worry about.

hero_hook: Struggling to haul your old mattress to the curb in Detroit's rainy weather?
neighborhoods: Midtown, Corktown, Indian Village, Palmer Woods, Boston-Edison, New Center, Jefferson-Chalmers, West Village, Lafayette Park, Bagley, Livernois-McNichols, Woodbridge, Grandmont-Rosedale, Mexicantown, University District

curbside_rules.size_limits: Grass clippings, leaves, and small twigs no more than two inches in diameter. Branches and twigs up to four feet in length and no more than four inches in diameter should be bundled and tied securely.
curbside_rules.schedule_logic: Yard waste collection runs March 31 through December 19 and will be picked up weekly at the curbline with the rest of your solid waste. Residents can place grass clippings, leaves, and small twigs that are no more than two inches in diameter in biodegradable paper bags on their bi-weekly scheduled bulk collection day.

weather_profile.rejection_risk_copy: WARNING: Detroit averages 100+ rainy days per year. If your mattress gets wet before pickup, the city WILL NOT take it (too heavy, mold risk). Our haulers pick up from inside your home — rain or shine.
